node.text:
Today on The Genius Life I welcome Zak Williams (@zakpym). Zak is the son of the late Robin Williams, an actor and comedian loved the world over who died from suicide in 2014 at the age of 63. Some months after Robin Williams death, it was revealed that he was suffering from the same rare form of dementia my own mother suffered from for 8 years prior to her death. ⁣
⁣
In the aftermath of the tragedy, Zak has become a passionate advocate for mental health. Among his efforts, he’s the co-founder and CEO of Prepare Your Mind (@youcanpym), a mission-driven company that creates all-natural mood supporting products. In our conversation, Zak shares how the death of his father galvanized his campaign for mental health advocacy and helped him heal in the service of others.⁣
⁣
We also talk about dementia, alcoholism, suicide, depression, therapy, and practical low cost ways to get help… this episode runs deep and I hope you listen through to the end.⁣
⁣
Also, thank you to @NYPost @People and @DailyMail for the incredible coverage we’ve received on this episode. 🙏🏼⁣
⁣
Listen wherever you get podcasts by searching The Genius Life and hitting Subscribe.⁣ And tag a friend who needs to hear this. ❤️
⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max⁣
⁣
#mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #depression #anxiety #mentalillness #mentalhealthmatters

node.text: It had been 8 years since I’ve played through a PA but I was psyched to do it last weekend at @startlosangeles in support of @buildingcommunitythroughart to support local artists and music venues in LA. This is another song I wrote in ~2008 called Don’t Cry which I recorded for an EP called One Year Later (you can hear another song from that EP that I posted a few days ago on my feed). I stopped writing songs to pursue writing about health science, but it’s still a huge part of me and who knows, maybe I’ll do it more in the future. Happy Saturday!

node.text:
Reverse osmosis technology pioneer Robert Slovak (@robtslovak) is on my podcast this week breaking down all things WATER; from hydration to purification to remineralization, we cover it all!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
We also discuss a fascinating topic that is new to me: deuterium! Did you know that not all H2O is created equally? It's really quite mind-blowing, and Robert breaks it all down. Have you tuned in? Let me know.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Also, the 𝐆𝐞𝐧𝐢𝐮𝐬 𝐋𝐢𝐟𝐞 𝐕𝐈𝐏 sign-ups close soon, so make sure if you'd like to take your health and nutrition to the next level, you're in! Click the link in my bio to learn more.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max⁣
⁣

#water #h2o #h2ojustaddwater #hydration #healthyfood #healthylifestyle #healthy #wellness #wellnesswednesday #reverseosmosis

node.text: It’s been 8 years since I’ve played through a PA but I was psyched to do it this weekend at @startlosangeles in support of @buildingcommunitythroughart to support local artists and music venues in LA. I used to play music in many LA venues and the thought of them struggling right now kills me! This is a song I wrote in ~2008 called Weather Advisory which I recorded for an EP called One Year Later. It was my moms favorite song I had written. Of course I gave up writing music to peruse writing about health science, but it’s still a huge part of me. Happy Monday!

node.text:
The debate continues 🔥⁣⁣
⁣⁣
This week I released a BONUS episode of The Genius Life featuring @drmarkhyman! 🥳⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
We slice through nutrition dogma to separate fact from fiction about:⁣⁣⁣
- Is meat healthy or unhealthy?⁣⁣⁣
- Should you opt for lean protein or fatty meat?⁣⁣⁣
- Does eating low carb (vs. low fat) give you any advantage?⁣⁣⁣
- How to stop being hungry all the time!⁣⁣⁣
- Is animal agriculture harmful to the environment?⁣⁣⁣
- Where to find plant "toxins" that actually make you stronger and help you detox⁣⁣⁣
- and much more!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Click the link in my profile bio to listen to the whole episode. You can also go to any podcast app and search The Genius Life.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max⁣
⁣

node.text:
The man, the myth, the legend @mindpumpsal is BACK on my podcast this week!⁣
⁣
Sal is a fitness expert with more than 20 years of training experience and has just released his first book, 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘙𝘦𝘴𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘛𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘙𝘦𝘷𝘰𝘭𝘶𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯, which I highly recommend.⁣
⁣
Sal is amazing because he marries his extensive fitness experience with his passion for wellness and longevity. He shares how to age-proof your body, bust through weight loss plateaus, and boost your metabolism so you're burning fat even while you sleep.⁣
⁣
Link in profile bio or search THE GENIUS LIFE wherever you get podcasts.⁣
⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max

node.text:
Hey fam (and new followers!)!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I just wanted to give you a heads up that my books Genius Foods and The Genius Life are much deeper dive on any of the concepts I talk about on Instagram. You should definitely consider picking either or both up if you'd like to take your understanding of health and nutrition to the next level!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Genius Foods is a nutritional care manual for the human brain. Whether you love the way your brain works and you want to protect it, or you'd like it to function better, Genius Foods is an amazing resource. It tackles literally everything we know about food and mood, dementia prevention, the gut-brain axis, and even dementia treatment.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
The Genius Life is about how to get the strongest and healthiest body possible (which of course will also benefit the brain), and in it you'll discover how to reorient your body to time, nature, cold, hot, beneficial forms of stress that actually makes you stronger and more resilient, and a diet and exercise plan that is specifically calibrated for body recomposition (i.e. fat loss and/or muscle gain). ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Both of my books are available wherever you get books and you can follow the link in my profile bio for easy access!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I'd really appreciate your support, but more importantly, I'd love to see you integrate these books into your life. I wrote them because of a family tragedy and am grateful to see that thousands upon thousands of people around the world have already been impacted. Also, each book has been translated into many languages. and more coming.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Thank you so much for following me here. Your attention is not something I do not take lightly. Let me know in the comments if you'll be picking up 1 of my books and which! 👇🏼⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
❤️ Max⁣⁣
⁣⁣
📸 @wordmariah⁣
⁣
P.S. Both are also available as audiobooks and I narrate both myself! 🎧😌

node.text:
Normalize 👏🏼 personal 👏🏼 agency 👏🏼!!!! (Swipe for more tips literally anyone can use!)
.
Food equity is crucially important!!! More than 20 million people live in what are called food deserts, where fresh food is hard to come by. That’s why I wanted to share key tips almost anyone can use to boost their health, no matter who or where they are. Obviously I can’t reach or consider everyone’s unique situation but this should help most!
.
If you care, tag 3 friends to share this information so that it actually gets out there. 🤗
.
In this post I’m sharing nutrient-dense and highly satiating foods that are inexpensive and can be found almost anywhere. Notice I didn’t say anything about grass-fed or organic—these foods are still BARGAINS for the nutrition they provide. I also am sharing money saving tips that can help you cut down on your grocery bills. Finally, simple lifestyle tips almost anyone can do to improve their health. 🌱 
.
Now I know that this post won’t reach or be relevant to everybody, and that’s ok, but we can each do our part by spreading this information to those who need to hear it. Almost everyone, anywhere can do at least something to improve their health, so let’s empower all we can!
.
Love you guys! Happy Wednesday. 🙏🏼❤️ Max

node.text:
Which of these get you? 🧐
.
Eating clean is a funny term with no scientific basis but I understand why it exists. Because most of the foods we now consume are ultra-processed industrial creations with myriad ingredients you often can’t pronounce and are not included for any nutritional benefit whatsoever. It’s a sign that consumers want food that is closer to its natural state, and I’m down with that.
.
But “eating clean” doesn’t really guarantee much in the way of weight maintenance or weight loss if you consider these common pitfalls. My favorite are probably fruit (usually date) sweetened snacks, which are super calorie dense yet would fall under the “clean eating” mantra. Yes these are better for you then candy, but can still throw a wrench into your weight loss goals if you aren’t careful, you know?
.
Which trips you up? I’d love to know in the comments. 🥰
.
🙏🏼❤️ Max

node.text:
The ball is in your court!⁣
⁣
Despite the popular narrative dietary cholesterol has minimal effect on blood cholesterol levels.⁣ 🤯
⁣
The 2015 Dietary Guideline Committee dropped the cholesterol guidelines. They dropped the recommendation because the scientific evidence did not support having a dietary guideline for cholesterol. ⁣
⁣
We were the last country to drop this recommendation 🤔 ⁣
⁣
The evidence shows if you go from a high cholesterol diet 500-700 mg to a low cholesterol there will be a transient 3-7% decrease in total cholesterol and that will rebound with in 4 to 6 weeks.⁣
⁣
Similar changes can happen if you increase cholesterol intake. ⁣
⁣
The reason, blood cholesterol is largely regulated by liver synthesis and LDL (transport and disposal) blood cholesterol is heavily genetically set. ⁣
⁣
EGGS 🥚 HAVE ESSENTIALLY NO EFFECT ON BLOOD CHOLESTEROL. 
⁣
This has been shown in multiple studies (Note, the average egg intake is 3 to 4 per week).⁣
⁣
The body requires a 1000 mg per day of cholesterol for cell membranes and hormones and the majority made in the liver. The average dietary intake in the US is around 300mg daily and the body only absorbs about 50% of dietary cholesterol, so that means we get about a 150 mg per day from your diet and the body has to make 850 mg. ⁣
⁣
Dietary cholesterol is almost irrelevant to blood cholesterol. I shared a case study recently where an 88 year old man ate 25 eggs a day for over a decade and had normal cholesterol! Now everyone’s different (he absorbed less in his gut than controls in the study) but the point is, don’t fear it.⁣
⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max⁣
⁣
Post image and caption by @drgabriellelyon (I’ve added some edits). I had her on my podcast recently (ep. 149) and it was 🔥. Click link in bio to listen. ⁣
⁣
#healthylifestyle #ketobreakfast #hflc #highprotein #letseat ⠀⁣
#modifiedketo #mindfulnessmeditation #lawofattraction #hersuccess #womenshealthmatters

node.text:
Kid 1: "Mom/dad said these are good for us. Let's not eat them."⁠⠀
Kid 2: "Smart."⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Every kid is different but sometimes telling someone something is "good for them" can make them NOT want to eat it (know any adults like this? I do! 😆).⁠⠀
⁠⠀
You don’t need to make stuff up like "This food will make you tall" or scare little kids with "You're teeth will fall out if you don't eat this." The facts are super interesting! Kids LOVE learning what food does in their body.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
When we give kids age-appropriate information about what food does in their body, we help them learn to take care of their body so they can do awesome stuff in their lives.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
We can start with simple connections with our little ones. Food does something in our body. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Then we follow their curiosity as they get older and teach more: ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Colors do different things. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Then we learn about nutrients. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Then we learn nutrients do lots of cool and important things. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
We learn how to include these nutrients in our diet so we don't have to think about nutrients (similar to how eating the right foods as adults means we don’t have to think about calories!).⁠⠀
⁠⠀
We learn the nutrients are lots of places. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
When they are much older and they are curious, talk about what happens if we don't eat a nutrient—without turning it into a fear-mongering situation.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
These sort of messages can be so much more powerful than "healthy" or "good for you."⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Post credit @kids.eat.in.color 👏🏼⠀
⁠Does this make sense? Let me know!⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Hope you’re having a good weekend. 🙏🏼❤️ Max
⁠ •

node.text:
Added Sugars Hide in More Foods Than You May Think! (Swipe to see more examples) ⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
Here’s an illustration of how sugars can really add up in processed foods- even foods you may have thought to be healthier or ‘low sugar’. Now there’s nothing wrong with treating yourself to these foods on occasion, but consuming them regularly can really add up.⁠⁠⁣
⁣
Photo cred: @meowmeix⁣
⁠⁠⁣
Two important things to keep track of:⁠⁠⁣
👉 Your total sugar load for the day ⁠⁠⁣
👉 How much added sugar you’re having in a day⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
What’s important to note is that not all sugar is bad, however when it’s NOT paired with fiber like that found in fruit, it can lead to a sugar spike and crash. Fruit juice is a good example of something with “no added sugar” but since the fiber is stripped it’s easy to over-consume and often leads to a spike & crash.⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
Additionally, added sugars can become addicting, leading your body to crave more of these foods. That’s why I recommend going for your fav fruit when you feel a sweet tooth coming on. It’s paired with fiber which helps slow the absorption of the sugar and comes with additional benefits like vitamins and minerals. Plus, they’re straight up delicious! ⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
Here are the details of each food and it’s sugar content: ⁠⁠⁣
-’Green’ Juice: contains a whopping 53 grams of sugar and 0 grams of fiber.⁠⁠⁣
-Strawberry Frappuccino: packs in 51g sugar per 16oz serving.⁠⁠⁣
-Orange Juice: one serving contains 31g sugar & no fiber. ⁠⁠⁣
-Standard Cereal w/ Milk: has 28g sugar per bowl. Most cereals contain lots of added sugars, artificial flavors, colors, etc.⁠⁠⁣
-Standard Jelly: contains 24g sugar per 2 tbsps, which is about what the average person uses in one sitting. ⁠⁠⁣
-Baked Beans: one half cup contains 20g sugar! While most people think of beans as being healthy, this type is one you’d certainly want to limit. ⁠⁠⁣
-Flavored Yogurt: each of these flavored yogurts comes with 20g sugar, which is why it’s a good idea to opt for unflavored yogurt and add your own fruit, honey, etc. . ⁠⁠⁣
-Standard Granola Bar: One pack of standard granola bars contains 11g sugar, canola oil, & brown sugar syrup.⁠⁠⁣
#healthyfood #nutrition #healthyeating

node.text:
4 low-carb, high-protein recipes, 1 simple staple ingredient (swipe to see the rest!)⁣⁣ 🐟
⁣⁣
I recently did an interview with sustainable seafood expert @bartonseaver who confirmed that canned tuna is an incredibly healthy, cheap, and widely available food. You can find it everywhere—even gas stations!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
It's loaded with quality protein, vitamins, and even a little bit of omega-3s (tuna isn't a fatty fish but still contains some of those valuable EPA and DHA fats). Each of these recipes also happen to be keto-friendly!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
So if you're budget conscious, don't be afraid of canned tuna! And since I know I'm going to get questions about 'Seaspiracy'... be sure to listen to episode 179 of my podcast which is a thorough debunking!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Recipes (INGREDIENTS IN COMMENTS):⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Tuna Salad / Avocado⁣⁣
- Combine all ingredients except the avocado and mix well⁣⁣
- Slice the avocado in half, remove pit, and top with tuna salad⁣
⁣⁣
Tuna Meatballs⁣
- Heat EVOO in a pan and saute diced onion, minced garlic and chopped baby spinach until fragrant and spinach is wilted
- Combine all other ingredients and mix well by hand⁣⁣
- Bake at 400 for 20-25 minutes until meatballs are golden and crispy⁣⁣
- Optional but highly recommended: Combine 1/3 cup greek yogurt, 1 tbsp chopped dill, the juice of 1/2 lemon for a take on tzatziki dipping sauce and serve on side⁣
⁣⁣
Tuna Burger⁣⁣
- Combine all ingredients and mix well by hand⁣⁣
- Form patties using your hands, recipe makes 2 patties ⁣
- Pro tip: Let patties hang out in fridge for 30-45mins to ensure they really bind together⁣
- Grill or pan fry until brown and crispy on both sides⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Tuna Deviled Eggs⁣⁣
- Boil eggs, slice in half, remove yolks and place in a bowl⁣⁣
- Combine yolks with all other ingredients, mash and mix well⁣⁣
- Scoop out deviled egg mixture into halved egg whites ⁣
- Garnish with paprika and chives ⁣

⁣⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max⁣⁣
⁣⁣

node.text:
Drop a YES if you already do any of these things 🙌🏼⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Getting lean requires a lifestyle shift; not a diet! Diets are temporary. Your lifestyle is your life, styled around your goals which should include getting to and staying at your ideal body weight and fitness level!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Notice how I didn’t say “calorie deficit” or “counting your calories”? That’s because while constructing your diet in a way that allows you to achieve a calorie deficit will help you get lean if you aren’t already, permanently being in a calorie deficit isn’t healthy! It’s a catabolic (“breaking down”) state that over the long term can negatively impact your endocrine system, among other things. And with the right food habits, you shouldn’t need to count calories to *stay* lean, unless you want to of course!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max⁣⁣
⁣⁣

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Max Lugavere on July 24, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Max Lugavere @maxlugavere idk who needs to hear this but being mindful about what you eat doesn't mean you have an an unhealthy relationship with food.'.

node.text:
Shoutout to all my peeps with health and fitness goals ✊🏼
.
There’s a weird dogma in the the nutrition space that the only way to have a healthy relationship with food is to eat whatever you want without restriction. I’m here to tell you that you actually CAN be mindful about what you put in your face hole while still also having a healthy relationship with food.
.
I think the confusion arises when we start to label ourselves as bad or good when we eat certain things, or feel guilt. I’m not about that life; what you eat does NOT define you, and you should never feel guilt about your choices. When you understand how food affects your behavior—a topic I talk a lot about—it’s always going to be informed consent.
.
But perhaps we should also discuss which foods are more supportive of long term satiety, a healthy body composition, and positive nutrient status.
.
We all know that foods like fresh fruits, veggies, grass fed beef, eggs, and salmon are good for us, and it goes without saying that one meal of these foods isn’t going to do much for your health; it’s about your dietary pattern as a whole. So why can’t we also admit that, while one serving here or there might not do us harm, foods like donuts, fried chicken dishes, sugar sweetened beverages are nonetheless not the best for us?
.
Just some Saturday morning thoughts. Love you fam! ❤️ Max
.
#wellnessjourney #weightloss #nutrition #healthylifestyle #healthyliving

node.text:
The power of marketing ( ⏩ swipe to see some much better choices)⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
It’s crazy how much marketing can shape and mold our opinion of certain brands. Let’s be real - it’s because marketing works!⁠⁠⁣
⁣
Love this post by @meowmeix.⁣
⁠⁠⁣
It is becoming increasingly important that we become conscious consumers and really start to question if brands actually live it up to the stories and claims they put out there.⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
The marketing thrown at children these days, with highly processed foods especially irritates me. So many boxes covered in cartoons and colorful imagery trying to draw kids in.⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
The Hawaiian Punch for example is pretty much just water & high fructose corn syrup with food dyes - yikes! Less that 2% is made from real fruit juices yet the company happily displays all the wonderful fruit on the front of the package.⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
As for gatorade, the amount of marketing tying that brand in with pro-athletes is unbelievable. Yet, a simple choice like coconut water full of natural electrolytes would be much better than all the filler ingredients and food dye added to this drink. I’ve also added some more options for athletes in the third graphic including my fav, LMNT (LMNT is a sponsor of my podcast but I love that they’re sugar free option and oh so tasty - drinkLMNT.com/geniuslife for a free sample pack).⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
Water is also such an under appreciated macronutrient but I’m advocating we start putting water back on its pedestal! If you’re looking to add more flavor to your daily water, try incorporating fresh fruits or herbs in your batches of water.⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
I hope you found this helpful! Let me know what other brands you’d like me to talk about.⁣
⁣
Love you guys,⁠⁠⁣
Max⁠⁠⁣
⁠⁠⁣
#healthyeating #healthyfood #atheletes #nutrition #foodfacts #eattherainbow

node.text:
Today on The Genius Life I welcome Zak Williams (@zakpym). Zak is the son of the late Robin Williams, an actor and comedian loved the world over who died from suicide in 2014 at the age of 63. Some months after Robin Williams death, it was revealed that he was suffering from the same rare form of dementia my own mother suffered from for 8 years prior to her death. ⁣
⁣
In the aftermath of the tragedy, Zak has become a passionate advocate for mental health. Among his efforts, he’s the co-founder and CEO of Prepare Your Mind (@youcanpym), a mission-driven company that creates all-natural mood supporting products. In our conversation, Zak shares how the death of his father galvanized his campaign for mental health advocacy and helped him heal in the service of others.⁣
⁣
We also talk about dementia, alcoholism, suicide, depression, therapy, and practical low cost ways to get help… this episode runs deep and I hope you listen through to the end.⁣
⁣
Also, thank you to @NYPost @People and @DailyMail for the incredible coverage we’ve received on this episode. 🙏🏼⁣
⁣
Listen wherever you get podcasts by searching The Genius Life and hitting Subscribe.⁣ And tag a friend who needs to hear this. ❤️
⁣
🙏🏼❤️ Max⁣
⁣
#mentalhealth #mentalhealthawareness #depression #anxiety #mentalillness #mentalhealthmatters
